Father's Day: Cannot cook or handle kids.description: Fathers can’t multitask, can’t cook, manage household chores along with their work, or can’t balance their professional lives with the personal ones – these are just some stereotypes that we have grown up hearing. But the new-age dads, who stay in nuclear as well as joint families, where both husband and wife are working, are not only dividing the task of raising kids equally, but also making sure that they are available for their kids for a heart-to-heart conversation, advice on friendships, or period talks. From taking leaves for kids’ exams to cooking and helping them with homework – things that one would typically expect a mother would do – are being done by dads quite well, who believe in not just sharing finances, but other responsibilities, too. On Father’s Day, we speak to some dads and mothers leading by example, who tell us about the stereotypes that fathers are subjected to, and how they are breaking them and contributing as an equal parent. Dads not emotional, says who?Ankur Gupta, a doctor and resident of Sector 50, Gurgaon, says, “Fathers are not sensitive, kids turn to their mothers if they want to express their feelings; fathers are messy, don’t help in household chores; they are not interested in school grades, and are uncomfortable in parent-teacher meetings – these are some common stereotypes that most fathers in India are subjected to. Thankfully, these are not applicable to me as at a very early age my daughter realised that she could walk up to me and talk about anything that is bothering her emotionally. I am also interested in knowing about what is happening in her school. There is no division of labour at our home but my wife and I know about the things we are good at, so we take the lead accordingly. I know I am good at language and my wife can manage the finances well, so it is like an unsaid rule that we follow to help our family in that way.” Tilak Chowdhury, a resident of Sector 169, Noida, who works at a consulting firm, adds, “The stereotypes are not restricted to just, dads can’t cook or look after the kids, often, they are also considered very strict and someone who cannot have fun, or show any emotion in front of their kids. Why can’t people expect a father to be like Anupam Kher’s character in Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge who can encourage his kids when they fail, or do not perform well in studies, or can discuss their love lives openly like Rishi Kapoor’s character in Hum Tum?” Can’t discuss heartbreaks with dads – seriously? You cannot discuss problems related to heartbreaks or seek advice after a fight with friends with your father as they won’t understand them – new-age dads are trying to break this stereotype. “We understand and can give useful advice to the kids. Why do people find it so difficult to accept that fathers can also have emotions and kids can have a conversation with us on topics related to heartbreaks or can seek any other emotional advice? I have always been available to my kids whenever they have wanted me. I remember that my elder daughter, now 15, would return disturbed from school. One day, I asked her about what was bothering her as I was concerned. I did not mean to interfere in her personal life, but I told her that she could come up to me whenever she was comfortable talk about it, and I would try to help her in all my capacity. It took her two days to tell me that she was facing problems with a friend, who would often fight with her on petty issues. I told her that it was important to focus on the friendship if it was important to them, they can fight over petty issues but school days won’t come back. We started with this topic and then she opened up about her school life and her friends from the neighbourhood. I was glad that she could tell me everything. That day, my daughter understood that she can discuss her problems with me and I will try to help her,” shares Arjun Singh, a businessman who lives in Rajouri Garden and father to two teenage daughters. Arpana Prakash, who runs a dance school, adds, “When I asked my seven-year-old daughter about who would she first tell about her boyfriend, and she said, ‘Dad.’ That is the comfort level that they share. We could never think about having a talk about menstruation with our fathers but today’s generation surely can.” ‘Can take care of kids and deal with clients’Raj Hazarika says that he is often asked why he willingly contributes as a homemaker. “This is something that they expect a woman to do but I like cooking and also enjoy doing it for my kids. Playing, cooking or just being with my kids is important as they are growing up, and this time will never come back. Raising kids is not an easy task, and there is nothing wrong in being equally involved with your partner in doing so. One has to adjust a lot while dealing with kids. I can manage my clients or colleagues easily but dealing with kids and their temperament is another thing – something that every parent should learn hands- on,” says Raj, a resident of Sushant Lok 2 who runs a coaching academy. For some, it is also a way to bond with their kids. “My wife is a teacher and she leaves around 6.30am, so I wake up early before my kids leave for school and pack their lunch. I leave for work around 10am, so I have enough time to spend with my kids. We both are working parents, so I don’t see it as a problem that I am cooking for my kids. When I come from work, my kids are often asleep because my wife is with them after school and helps them with the homework. If I have my Saturdays off, then I help them with their homework or extra-curricular activities but that is something I want to do as a parent, and not because somebody is forcing me to. People can think that I am too involved in my family but I am doing this because this is what I want to do,” says Roshan Sharma, a resident of Saket, who works as a consultant in a firm. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Gun-flashing video: Two booked.description: GREATER NOIDA: Police have booked two unidentified men, who were seen in a video of a Maruti Eeco chasing a Volkswagen Polo in which an occupant was seen flashing a pistol. According to police sources, the incident took place on a road in Dadri leading towards Sector Omicron in Kasna. During investigation, it was found that one of the cars was using a fake number plate. Police said the occupants of the car are being traced through the number plate of one of the cars seen in the video. “The registration numbers of the two cars seen in the video were checked. However, for Maruti Eco, the website showed no data. This means that the number plate used was fake. The other car has been found to be registered in the name of a Delhi resident. We are trying to track the occupants of the Eco through him,” said Ajay Kumar, SHO (Kasna). “Primary investigation had revealed that the accused were shooting a drama sequence for social media. However, they had taken no such permission from the concerned authority, neither had they informed us about it,” said Kumar. An FIR has been registered against the accused under sections 419 (Cheating by personation), 420 (Cheating) and 290 (Public Nuisance) of the IPC. “The owner of the other car has been summoned to the police station. We are gathering information on the pistol that was used in the video,” Kumar added. The video featured the Eco and Polo running parallel to each other on a 130-metre road, where an occupant of the Eco could be seen flashing a pistol from the rear window towards another man sitting in the Volkswagen. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Amrapali homebuyers seek \u2018stress fu.description: NOIDA: To draw the attention of UP chief minister towards the plight of 42,000 investors stuck in various Amrapali projects, a homebuyers’ collective on Wednesday urged local MLA Pankaj Singh to help arrange a meeting with Yogi Adityanath, where they can demand a ‘stress fund’ to expedite the completion of over 30,000 pending flats by the developer. The CM will visit the city on June 14. “We urge the chief minister to look at the buyers’ plight and envisage a solution by generating liquidity to expedite completion. It has been a decade since the buyers have invested in Amrapali. The government should step in with some financial resolution to push the completion of the projects,” said KK Kaushal, an Amrapali buyer who has invested in a Dream Valley flat. Though the final order in the Amrapali case is still pending in the Supreme Court, a bench comprising justices Arun Mishra and UU Lalit had earlier asked Noida Authority if it could complete the pending work of Amrapali. The Authority, however, told the court that it was not “technically competent and lacked expertise to take up the task”. And according to an earlier estimate by the government-backed construction agency, NBCC, Rs 8,500 crore will have to be put together for completion of the delayed flats. “While the Supreme Court order is awaited for Amrapali, there is a need for a stress fund to support completion of the flats. We have been demanding the same for some time. We want to meet the CM to raise our demand for such a fund,” said Abhishek Kumar, president, Noida Extension Flat Owners’ Welfare Association (Nefowa). Amrapali has 15 residential properties with 42,000 units, of which 30,741 are still incomplete. Forensic investigation of the builder has revealed that the builder had taken Rs 11, 652 crore from homebuyers and invested only Rs 10, 630 crore for construction work, showing a fund diversion of Rs 1,022 crore. When contacted, an official from MLA Pankaj Singh’s office said, “We will definitely look into the buyers’ appeal and respond likewise.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida: Four cops, three police drivers p.description: NOIDA: As many as 15 people, including a police post in-charge, have been arrested for allegedly extorting money from targets by framing them in false rape cases. The accused, including the Sector 44 chowki in-charge, three constables and three PCR van drivers, were produced in the Meerut anti-corruption court on Tuesday and sent to jail. The three constables, Manoj Kumar, Ajayveer Singh and Devendra Kumar, who were deployed at the Sector 44 chowki, were allegedly caught “red-handed” as they were taking money from one of their targets by a team led by the Noida SSP and including the circle officer 1 and the Sector 39 SHO between 9pm and 1am on the intervening night of June 10-11. Chowki in-charge sub-inspector Sunil Sharma was not present at the scene but was arrested later. The SSP claimed that Sharma’s name was taken by the arrested constables. PCR van drivers Vipin Singh, Durvesh Kumar and Rajesh Singh, six other individuals, Satish alias Ankit, Hariom Sharma, Suresh Kumar, Deshraj, Anoop and Salim Khan, and two women, Vineeta (Satish’s wife) and Pooja, were subsequently arrested. According to police, SSP Vaibhav Krishna received information about a gang operating in the Sector 44 police chowki area under the patronage of Sunil Sharma. The gang members allegedly trapped high-profile businessmen and blackmailed them on the pretext of settlement of rape cases. The SSP had specific information about one of the targets, a Faridabad-based businessman who worked as a contractor in the Yamuna Expressway area. “The women would seek a lift from their target in the Sector 44 area and ask to be dropped at a spot where a PCR van would be parked. They would then complain to the constables in the van that they had been raped by the target and demand that a case be filed against him,” said the SSP. Next, the target would be taken to the police chowki, where Satish and Deshraj would enter the scene. “Satish would claim to be a lawyer and start writing an application on behalf of the women. Deshraj would enter the scene as a chairman and mediate between the accused and the women, suggesting that money be paid to settle the case. The gang would keep the vehicle in their possession till the money was paid,” he said. The latest target, the Faridabad-based businessman, approached the SSP, saying his Honda City was being kept at the Sector 44 police chowki. The SSP said that the accused would take money of up to Rs six lakh from their targets. He added that the gang extorted money from as many as 15 people, but police have identified only three complainants, so far. Police have also recovered Rs 50,000, a Honda City car, a Verna car and a Grand i10 car from the accused. An FIR has been lodged against the accused under IPC sections 384 (punishment for extortion), 120b (criminal conspiracy), 411 (dishonestly receiving stolen property) and Sections 7/13 of the Prevention of Corruption Act at the Sector 39 police station. According to police, a departmental inquiry would be initiated against the accused police officers. Police also said that the gang had been active for the past six months but Sunil Sharma joined the chowki only in March, this year. Three of the accused, Satish, Vineeta and Pooja, had been arrested by Faridabad police in 2014 and 2017 for framing and cheating people in a similar manner. Those cases are still pending in court, according to police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

UP chief minister bats for jobs to local.description: GREATER NOIDA: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday said local youths should be given jobs in development projects, while also asking officials to address the issue of their employability through skill development programmes, as he made his ninth visit to Noida. He also asked bureaucrats to work towards improved living standards and safety of people living in Noida and Greater Noida. The CM’s comments came during a review meeting, the first to be chaired by him, of the district’s three development authorities — Noida, Greater Noida and YEIDA. “Local youths should be given jobs, skill development should be provided to local people through CSR drives and Noida and Greater Noida should be developed as smart cities under sustainable development norms with ‘sabka saath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas’ as the underlying guideline,” he said at the meeting, echoing Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The meeting was held at the Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority’s (GNIDA) office. The CM was accompanied by chief secretary Anup Chandra Pandey, MP Mahesh Sharma, excise and prohibition minister Jai Pratap Singh, industry minister Satish Mahana, Noida MLA Pankaj Singh, Jewar MLA Dhirendra Singh and Dadri MLA Tejpal Nagar. He was received by district magistrate BN Singh and all three authority CEOs Alok Tandon (Noida), Narendra Bhooshan (GNIDA) and Arun Vir Singh (YEIDA) in the presence of distruct police chief Vaibhav Krishna at the Expo Centre helipad around 4.30pm. Yogi also stressed “inclusive” growth as he asked officers to ensure that villages too developed alongside urban areas. “Basic amenities should be provided to villages, and aspirations of local youths should not be ignored,” he said. MLA Pankaj Singh observed metro stations in the twin cities should include village names along with the sector/area names that are currently on station boards. The biggest infrastructure project in NCR — Jewar international airport — expectedly came up at the meeting. The project, for which the government has started the process of identifying relocation sites for displaced locals and giving compensation — will, in the CM’s words. “be ready in the next couple of years”. He said the area around airport should be developed considering long-term requirements of the area. The DM assured “all formalities regarding 80% land acquisition for Jewar airport will be completed by August 30”. The CM also said people entering Noida, Greater Noida and the Yamuna Expressway area should feel a “positive change”. “There’s immediate need to improve the traffic situation, waste disposal and general safety,” he said. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Noida: Protest at ESIC as doctor \u2018s.description: NOIDA: Health services were disrupted at the ESIC hospital (Sector 24) for three hours on Friday after a doctor allegedly slapped an office staffer. Protests broke out after that as employees raised slogans against hospital management. The office superintendent of the hospital was allegedly slapped on Thursday by a doctor who complained about medical officers being included in committees on administrative issues. Office superintendent Samir Nayak gave a written complaint against the doctor to the director of the institute. But as no action was taken till Thursday, the employees decided to go on a strike. Around 25 employees refrained from work between 9 pm and noon. Deputy medical superintendent Dr Balraj Bhandari told TOI the management has decided to constitute a committee to look into the case and removed the doctor from administrative posts. Bank shared account statement without co.description: GREATER NOIDA: A Delhi Police constable has accused a private bank official of unlawfully sharing her bank account statement with another person, without her permission. In a complaint filed at Sector 49 police station, Nisha said she came to know from her home branch at Asaf Ali Road in Delhi that a bank official at Noida’s Sector 51 branch took out a statement of her one year’s transaction without her knowledge. “In April, I received a message from the bank that mentioned Rs 300 was deducted from my account. I had immediately called up the customer care and learnt the money was deducted as a fee for obtaining a year’s account statement. When I told the representative that it was not me, he asked me to contact my home branch,” said Nisha. “Later I came to know from my home branch the statement was taken out by an official of Noida’s Sector 51 branch,” she added. Nisha claimed the Noida police are not registering an FIR in the case even after one and a half months of her complaint. “A probe is underway. We’ve asked the bank to give details on how the private information was leaked without permission. An FIR will be filed only after the preliminary probe is complete,” said Ajay Kumar Aggarwal, SHO of Sector 49 police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida, known for twin cities, set to get.description: GREATER NOIDA: When flight operations begin at the Jewar international airport, you will be taking off and landing from ‘Yeida City’. Like Noida, the acronym for another government body, Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA), will become the name for the third big city that the UP government will develop in Gautam Budh Nagar. Yeida City is being developed across the development authority’s 25,000-hectare urban area along the Yamuna Expressway, and will come up next to the site of the proposed airport at Jewar. Allotment of residential, commercial and industrial plots has started. The new city will have a commercial hub spread across 25 acres in Sector 18 of the Yamuna Expressway area. It’ll have a dedicated entertainment zone, including malls, retail shops, restaurants and open air theatre. “It has been decided that the urban area under YEIDA along the Yamuna Expressway will be developed like a city, which will be named Yeida City. While the office order was issued on Thursday, gazette notification will take some time,” Arun Vir Singh, CEO of Yeida, told TOI. With an international airport in Jewar on cards, the move is seen as timely to give a distinct name to Yamuna Expressway area. “Since there’s rapid development work underway, it’s time to give the area its identity as an urban city, hence the name Yeida City,” said Singh. While YEIDA area, which is spread on 2,688 sq km across six districts of Uttar Pradesh, has neighbouring cities like Noida, Greater Noida, Dadri, Mathura, Khurja, Faridabad and Agra, the upcoming Jewar airport at a distance of 28.4 km from zero point of Yamuna Expressway will be the focal point of the new city. Formed about 18 years ago for the development of Taj Expressway, YEIDA Master Plan 2031 entails that the Yamuna Expressway area which consists of 24,739 hectares as urban area will have 4,569 hectares (19%) reserved for residential purposes, 4,698 hectares for industrial (26%) and 5,148 hectares (22%) for a green cover. Apart from the new city, some 29 of 334 villages of Gautam Budh Nagar, Mathura, Agra, Mahamaya Nagar (Hathras), Bulandshahar and Aligarh that are notified under YEIDA, will be developed as smart villages, with all urban civic facilities, including sewage, drainage, roads, drinking water, electricity, optical fiber for telephone and cable connectivity etc, in the next three years, starting with 10 villages in this financial year. “These 10 villages will be developed at a cost of Rs 80 crore (Rs 8 crore per village) in the current financial year. These are located along the Yamuna Expressway, where YEIDA had conducted a drone survey. Starting July, work will first begin on five villages — Acheja Buzurg, Rampur Bangar, Dungarpur Reelka, Nilloni Shahpur and Chandpur,” said Singh. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Botanical parking among big projects nea.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority is all set to complete 12 large infrastructure projects worth Rs 1,502 crore in the current financial year, officials said. The district hospital, five multilevel parking lots, a biodiversity park in Sector 91, a multi-purpose indoor stadium, a shooting range and a bus depot are some of the projects that are likely to be opened soon. The bridge across Shahdara drain, between Sectors 14 and 14A, would be ready this month — the first of the 12 projects to be completed. “The bridge, costing about Rs 6 crore, is almost ready and can be opened by June. We are conducting regular inspections of the district hospital and the parking lots to ensure they are ready on time,” said Rajeev Tyagi, general manager, Noida Authority. The district hospital in Sector 39 is being built at a cost of Rs 346 crore and is expected to be inaugurated by October 1. Multilevel parking lots at sectors 5 and 38A, near Botanical Garden, are expected to be ready by August. The parking lot in Sector 38A is the costliest of the 12 projects. Being built at a cost of Rs 577 crore, it can accommodate around 7,000 cars and can also be used as a bus parking area to reduce congestion near Botanical Garden metro station. An underground car parking lot at Sector 16A, near Film City, will be ready by October and two others at sectors 1 and 3 are likely to be ready by December. The bus depot at Sector 82 will be ready by March, officials said. Shaheed Bhagar Singh Park in Sector 150, costing Rs 28 crore, and the biodiversity park in Sector 91, costing Rs 42 crore, are expected to be ready by the end of this year. “But before an official inauguration, we hope to plant more trees and increase foliage and greenery in these parks, which may take till December,” said Tyagi. In the 2017-18 fiscal, the Authority had finished pending projects worth Rs 1,200 crore. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Buses from Gr Noida for char dham yatra.description: Greater Noida: The UP State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) has started a daily bus service from its Greater Noida depot to Haridwar in the wake of the char dham yatra. Part of the yatra — Kedarnath and Badrinath — falls in Uttarakhand. The buses will ply twice a day — 5.30am from Greater Noida depot via Alpha commercial metro station and again at 7pm. Officials said the fare from Greater Noida depot will be Rs 279 for Haridwar and Rs 275 from Alpha commercial metro station. “Residents of Greater Noida and those from Uttarakhand have long been demanding a bus service to Haridwar. So, we decided to provide this facility, which will benefit residents of not only Noida and Greater Noida, but also Ghaziabad, Meerut, Roorkie etc,” said Luv Kumar, assistant regional manager of UPSRTC’s Greater Noida depot. According to Kumar, the route of the bus, which can carry up to 52 passengers a trip, will include Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Modinagar, Meerut, Muradnagar, Khatauli, Muzaffarnagar and Roorkee. Kumar further maintained that the number of buses might be increased, depending on the demand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida techie held hostage in his car, ro.description: NOIDA: A 31-year-old techie was abducted in his car, assaulted and robbed of his vehicle — all in a span of four hours — before being abandoned by a four-member gang in Noida on Friday night, police said. Around 9.30pm on Friday, the victim Mohit Gupta, a resident of Vivek Vihar in Sector 82, was returning home from Sector 36 via the Noida-Greater Noida Expressway when his Ritz was overtaken by three youths and a middle-aged man. Gupta apparently told police that the assailants arrived in a car and opened the passenger-side door of his Ritz. Gupta, who works as a senior analyst with a private tech firm in Noida, said the accused seemed to be locals. While Gupta tried to run away, the men overpowered him and pushed him at the back seat, and one of them started to drive the car. The victim told TOI that the accused kept driving, leaving behind the car in which they had come. The accused showed him a knife and claimed to have a gun, he added. “They stopped near an ICICI Bank ATM and withdrew some money. They were addressing each other as Gaurav alias Pandit, Aditya, Shanky and Chotu. They continued to drive for four hours and left me near Pari Chowk around 1.30 am,” Gupta said, adding that the accused fled away with his car. He said that he was beaten up throughout the journey. According to the complaint filed by Gupta, police have registered an FIR against the four accused under Section 392 (robbery) of the Indian Penal Code. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Fake rape cases: Woman asked for lift, r.description: NOIDA: A printing press owner on Thursday lodged a complaint against former Sector 44 chowki in-charge and others, who were arrested earlier this week for being part of a gang that blackmailed people by framing them in fake rape cases. In the latest FIR lodged against SI Sunil Sharma, constable Ajayveer and one Vineeta, the complainant said he was cheated by them on April 15 when he was returning home from his workplace in Sector 10 in his Maruti Dzire. He alleged that he came across Vineeta near Sector 37 bus stop, who asked him for a lift till Sector 44 sabzi mandi. “When we reached the area, she asked me to stop the car where a police car was parked,” the FIR read. It states that Vineeta started shouting when a few cops, including Ajayveer, nabbed him and brought him to the chowki. "Sunil did not listen to my side of the story and asked the woman to call some more people," the victim said. “After this, a person who claimed to be a lawyer in the Delhi High Court arrived and started threatening me. He said I would be jailed for raping her. The chowki in-charge too was in agreement with them. They pressurised me to settle the matter for Rs 10 lakh to which I did not agree,” the FIR stated. The complainant was released only after he gave Rs 3,50,000 to the accused. Following the complaint, the sector 39 police have lodged an FIR in the matter against Sharma, Ajayveer and Vineeta under IPC section 384 (extortion) on Thursday. Sector 39 SHO Rajesh Sharma said total of three FIRs have been lodged in the case, so far, and these will be probed by Circle Officer II. Gautam Budh Nagar SSP Vaibhav Krishna said another complainant said he was cheated of Rs. 12 lakhs but is not ready to lodge an FIR. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
